column4: mame is probably the best neogeo emulator out there, gngeo is ok to (and supports the home console like options)
the mame version in the repos doesn't work, and GnGeo is a long dead project
if you claim both mame and mednafen "don't work" perhaps they're not the issue.  good luck.

mednafen launches and loads the rom, but gets stuck in a constant loop of configuring keys, the version of mame in the repos launches, but crashes when you do anything, I can't even get it to load a bios or a rom
I've had the same kind of issues with bsnes and zsnes, neither of those runs either, zsnes crashes silently and bsnes launches, doesn't load a rom and doesn't do anything till manually killed
well, sdlmame (if available in ubuntu) is a big improvement over xmame -- but neither is "easy" to setup.
are you using ati graphics by chance?
sdlmame is what I've got, nope, Nvidia Geforce 6200 NV44a core
I take it you had no luck either? I did find a ppa for SNES9x which works for SNES, but that still does nothing for the lack of NeoGeo emulation
so long as your on 32bit zsnes is certainy my favourite snes emulator.  For neo-geo I think sdlmame is probably one of the best options.  good luck.
yeah I'm on 32 bit, but as I said, zsnes instantly crashes and bsnes launches but doesn't display anything, just runs invisibly eating resources silently till it's manually killed
well, i don't run ubuntu - so can't really comment on stability issues on your distro
mint? debian?
doesn't matter ;)  it's ot.  Not mint for sure.
you're missing the key, i take it you didn't use add-apt-repository (or similar) command to add the repo
weird, when I added the ppas months ago the software installed, any way to tell what PPAs they are from the error?
one is a PPA the other is tridex.net?  sorry no further suggestions, you could google the keys to find the repos probably.
Tridex would be the official Mate desktop repo.
i see.  3rd party repos seem silly to me (i consider PPAs 3rd party BTW)

I'm guessing the others are Snes9x and the Pithos PPA, the version of Pithos in the Ubuntu repos can't connect to the Pandora server and Snes9x is so far the only working SNES emulator I could find...
snes on 64bit is a big issue for me personally ;)
you wouldn't happen to know of a working MAME emulator would you?
sdlmame is more modern then xmame, i can say that for sure ;)
sdlmame is the best neogeo emulator, period ;)
